McGregor – Bankruptcy Stay Violations
Memorandum (Updated)
nn Between 11/21/2024 and 9/17/2025, Attorney Barbara H. Agricola filed TEN separate
pleadings and discovery actions in family court — all seeking to enforce equity/property debts,
modify support obligations, compel financial/property disclosures, or impose attorney’s fees on
Blaine McGregor. Each of these actions was filed AFTER Blaine’s Chapter 13 bankruptcy
petition on 9/20/2024 and each constitutes a willful violation of the automatic stay under 11
U.S.C. §362(a).
11/21/2024 – Renewed Motion for Pendente Lite Relief
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Blaine filed bankruptcy 'to avoid his required $2,000 equity payment.'
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Contempt finding; pause Brittany’s support obligation; attorney’s fees.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Father filed for bankruptcy in an effort to avoid his required $2,000.00 a month equity payment
to Mother… child support is due to be paused until Father resumes his equity payments.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Direct attempt to enforce equity installments and seek fees.
12/20/2024 – Motion to Modify Child Support (Contempt in Nonpayment)
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Blaine filed Ch. 13 and stopped paying $2,000 equity.
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Suspend or recalc Brittany’s support obligation; attorney’s fees.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Respondent informed Petitioner he would no longer pay her equity payments as ordered…
Petitioner has incurred attorney’s fees due solely to Respondent’s actions.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Uses bankruptcy-protected equity to attempt support modification and fee-shifting.
12/20/2024 – Contempt Nonpayment Petition
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Blaine failed to pay equity installments.
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Contempt finding and sanctions.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Respondent is in willful contempt for failing to make the $2,000.00 monthly equity payments
as ordered.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Classic contempt action to collect a property-division debt during bankruptcy.
12/20/2024 – Reply re Guardian ad Litem
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Blaine filed bankruptcy and is no longer paying $2,000 equity.
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Appointment of GAL; costs split.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Respondent has recently filed for bankruptcy and is no longer paying Petitioner the $2,000.00
a month she is owed…'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Improper use of bankruptcy-protected debt in unrelated GAL litigation.
6/18/2025 – Court Order
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Agricola pressed support modification despite bankruptcy.
(cid:127) Court’s Note: Modification held until final hearing.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Modification of child support is held pending final hearing. The Father is expected and remains
ordered to comply with custody and visitation.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Confirms active litigation over bankruptcy-protected equity.
7/24/2025 – Court Order
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Contempt/support issues still being pressed.
(cid:127) Court’s Note: Contempt to be addressed at final hearing.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Issues of contempt, failure/refusal in the past, etc., will be addressed at final hearing.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Confirms continued enforcement proceedings during Ch. 13.
9/3/2025 – Discovery Deficiency Letter
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Discovery 'deficient.'
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Supplement property list + bank records.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Please provide a detailed list of the personal property items… including wall décor, bedroom
lamps, memory boxes, and clothing. Your client is currently in a bankruptcy action…'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Compels property inventory & financial disclosures outside bankruptcy.
9/15/2025 – Discovery Requests
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Blaine must produce financial/property docs.
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Tax returns, income, car loan payoff, support records.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Provide statements for each and every car payment… and state if the debt accrued was paid
off in full as of March 1, 2024.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Misstates decree; demands bankruptcy-governed disclosures.
9/16/2025 – Motion to Compel
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Blaine failed to comply with discovery.
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Compel responses; attorney’s fees.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Petitioner avers that she has been forced to incur attorney’s fees and costs… Respondent be
ordered to reimburse Petitioner.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Attempts to impose monetary sanctions during bankruptcy.
9/17/2025 – Objection to Motion to Reduce Time to Submit Discovery
Responses
(cid:127) Key Allegation: Blaine sought to shorten discovery deadlines; Agricola opposed.
(cid:127) Relief Requested: Deny Blaine’s motion; order Blaine to pay Brittany’s attorney’s fees.
(cid:127) Quote: 'Petitioner has incurred significant attorney’s fees as a result of having to file this objection…
Petitioner prays this Honorable Court DENY Respondent’s Motion… and ORDER Respondent to pay
Petitioner’s attorney’s fees.'
(cid:127) Stay Violation: Again demands attorney’s fees against a bankruptcy debtor — barred by §362(a)(1)
and §362(a)(6).
Legal Authority
(cid:127) 11 U.S.C. §362(a) – Automatic stay prohibits collection, enforcement, discovery of estate property.
(cid:127) 11 U.S.C. §362(k) – Debtor entitled to actual damages, attorney’s fees, and punitive damages for
willful violations.
(cid:127) In re McLean, 794 F.3d 1313 (11th Cir. 2015) – Willful stay violations include legal actions to enforce
prepetition debts.
(cid:127) Taggart v. Lorenzen, 139 S. Ct. 1795 (2019) – Sanctions appropriate when there is no 'fair ground of
doubt.'
(cid:127) In re Roche, 361 B.R. 615 (Bankr. N.D. Ga. 2005) – Discovery requests for financial records during
bankruptcy = stay violation.
Professional Ethics Violations
Agricola’s conduct also violates Alabama Rules of Professional Conduct:
(cid:127) Rule 3.1 – Meritorious Claims and Contentions: Filed motions with no legal basis post-bankruptcy.
(cid:127) Rule 3.4(c) – Fairness to Opposing Party: Knowingly disobeyed binding federal law (the automatic
stay).
(cid:127) Rule 8.4(d) – Misconduct: Engaged in conduct prejudicial to the administration of justice by repeatedly
pressing stay-violating claims.
Damages
Based on the billing statement from Dianne Davis, P.C. (9/17/25):
(cid:127) Attorney’s Fees Paid: » $9,544.00
(cid:127) Outstanding Balance: $2,940.88
(cid:127) Grand Total Damages: $12,485.00
Quote from billing: 'Court Preparation, 6 @ $300.00 = $1,800.00… Deposition Prep, 2 @ $300.00 =
$600.00.'
These costs are actual damages caused by Agricola’s repeated stay violations and are recoverable
under §362(k).
Conclusion
From 11/21/24 through 9/17/25, Agricola filed ten pleadings and discovery actions in family court that
sought to enforce equity/property debts, modify child support, compel financial/property disclosures,
and demand attorney’s fees. Each constitutes a willful violation of the automatic stay. The pattern is
deliberate, repeated, and in bad faith.
Relief requested:
(cid:127) Actual damages ($12,485 in attorney’s fees).
(cid:127) Sanctions against Brittany and her counsel.
(cid:127) Punitive damages for repeated misconduct.
(cid:127) Referral to Alabama State Bar for professional ethics violations.
